ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: RATE SCHEDULE FOR WHOLESALE POWER SALES AT MARKET-BASED RATES

record_data.record_plain_text: THE DAYTON POWER AND LIGHT COMPANY RATE SCHEDULE FOR WHOLESALE POWER SALES AT MARKET-BASED RATES ARTICLE I -General Terms and Conditions I.1General Purpose The purpose of this Rate Schedule is for The Dayton Power and Light (the Company or Seller ) to provide for sales for resale of capacity, energy, and ancillary services at negotiated rates to parties desiring to take power hereunder ( Purchaser(s) ). This Rate Schedule shall become effective on the date established by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (the Commission ). I.2Availability Sales of capacity, energy, and ancillary services under this Rate Schedule are available to Purchasers, including investor-owned corporations, municipalities, rural electric cooperatives, power marketers, power brokers, and other wholesale purchasers, and any associations of such entities. The Company will not engage in any transaction hereunder if to do so would jeopardize its ability to provide reliable and economic service to its native load customers. 1.2.1 Ancillary services. PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which include spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM, and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchases for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. I.3Compliance with Commission Regulations. Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Seller s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the Seller s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Seller s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 1.3.1 Seller Category. Seller meets the criteria for being a Category 1 seller in the Northwest, Southeast, and Southwest Power Pool regions and a Category 2 seller in the Northeast, Southwest and Central Regions, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a). I.4Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. None. I.5Obligations of the Parties A Purchaser desiring to take power under this Rate Schedule shall sign a Service Agreement which shall apply to all transactions under this Rate Schedule between the Company and the Purchaser, and shall be accepted for filing by the Commission. By entering into a Transaction Agreement, the Purchaser agrees to take and pay for, and the Company agrees to furnish, such capacity, energy and ancillary services as may be mutually agreed upon, subject to the terms and conditions of this Rate Schedule as it may be in effect from time to time, and subject to the action of the Commission or any successor regulatory agency with jurisdiction over sales for resale of electricity. Each transaction shall be governed by this Rate Schedule, the Service Agreement and the Transaction Agreement exchanged between the parties with respect to such transaction. The parties are relying upon the fact that this Rate Schedule, the Service Agreement and all Transaction Agreements shall together form a single integrated agreement between the parties and that the parties would not otherwise enter into any transactions. I.6Termination This Rate Schedule may be terminated unilaterally by the Company in accordance with any regulatory requirements. Any Service Agreement hereunder may be terminated unilaterally by the Company or the Purchaser at any time in accordance with the requirements of the Commission. Termination of the Rate Schedule or Service Agreement shall not cause the termination prior to the terms of any Transaction Agreement for the sale of capacity, energy and ancillary services that is entered into prior to the termination of the Rate Schedule or Service Agreement, and the Rate Schedule and Service Agreement shall remain in effect until such sale terminates. I.7Amendment The Company shall have the right at any time to amend any provision of this Rate Schedule by furnishing an appropriate statement of such amendment to the Purchaser, and by unilaterally filing the same with the Commission pursuant to the provisions of Section 205 of the Federal Power Act or with such other regulatory agency as may have jurisdiction. Nothing in this Rate Schedule shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of the Company to unilaterally make application to the Commission for a change in rates or in any terms or condition under section 205 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. I.8Required Approvals The obligations of the Company and the Purchaser are subject to and conditioned on securing and retaining all rights-of-way, franchises, locations, approvals, permits and other rights and each party agrees to use its reasonable best efforts to secure and retain all such rights-of-way, franchises and other rights and approvals. I.9Creditworthiness In order to satisfy the Company of the ability of Purchaser to meet its obligations under this Rate Schedule, Service Agreement and/or applicable Transaction Agreement(s), the Company may, in accordance with standard commercial practices, conduct reasonable credit reviews. The Company may require Purchaser to provide and maintain in effect during the term of the Service Agreement, or applicable Transaction Agreement(s), such credit guaranty or surety, including but not limited to, an unconditional and irrevocable letter of credit, as well, in the Company s commercially reasonable judgment, provide adequate security for protection against the risk of nonpayment for transactions under the Service Agreement or applicable Transaction Agreement(s). I.10Billing and Payments (a)All bills shall be rendered monthly in such reasonable detail as the Purchaser may request. All bills shall be due and payable upon presentation. In the event of a dispute as to the amount of any bill, the Purchaser will notify the Company of the amount in dispute and the Purchaser will pay to the Company the total bill including the disputed amount. The Company shall refund, with interest at the rate described in paragraph (d), any portion of the disputed, amount ultimately found to be incorrect. In the event adequate billing data are not available, bills may be rendered on an estimated basis subject to prompt corrective adjustment when such data are received. (b)The Purchaser shall not have the right to challenge any bill, invoice or statement or bring any court or administrative action of any kind questioning the same or seeking refunds after a period of 12 months from the date it is rendered. In the case of a bill, invoice or statement containing estimates, the Purchaser shall not have the right to challenge its accuracy after a period of 12 months from the date it is adjusted to reflect the actual amounts due. The Purchaser s rights hereunder relate to the accuracy of the billing computation and do not relate to the justness and reasonableness of the rate negotiated between Company and the Purchaser. (c)Within a reasonable time after the first day of each month, the Company shall submit an invoice to the Purchaser for the charges for all service provided under the Service Agreement for the preceding month. In order that bills may be rendered promptly after the end of each month, it may be necessary, from time to time, to estimate certain factors involved in calculating the monthly billing. Adjustments for errors in such estimates shall be included in subsequent bills at the time the information becomes available to make the required corrections or adjustment. The invoice shall be paid by the Purchaser so that Company will receive the funds by the twentieth (20th) day after the date that such invoice is rendered. All payments shall be made in immediately available funds payable to Company, or by electronic transfer to a bank named by Company. When payments are made by mail, bills shall be considered as having been paid on the date of receipt by Company. If by check: The Dayton Power and Light Company 1065 Woodman Drive Dayton, Ohio 45432 Attention: Jennifer Kendo If by wire transfer: Bank One, Columbus ABA # 044000037 Account No. 905753680 Confirmation of transfer: Name: Jennifer Kendo Telephone: (937) 259-7890 (d)Interest on any unpaid amount shall be calculated in accordance with the methodology specified for interest on refunds in the Commissions regulations at 18 C.F.R. 35.19(a)(2)(iii). Interest on delinquent amounts shall be calculated from the due date of the bill to the date of payment. In order to deal with any abuse of the payment procedures, Company may, at its sole discretion, choose to impose in addition to the interest payment a late payment fee on a late payment equal to the product of the payment due times two percent (2%). Any invoice unpaid 30 days after the payment is due shall be subject to this late payment fee and the late payment fee will accrue on a monthly basis. I.11Points of Delivery and Metering The Company shall provide power to Purchaser at the agreed-upon point(s) of delivery under each Transaction Agreement, subject to the following conditions: a) services shall be provided in accordance with good electric utility practice; b) the Company shall verify all deliveries of power at the interconnection delivery point; c) unless otherwise agreed, the Company shall bear the risk for all transmission losses up to the point of delivery; and d) the Company shall be responsible for all transmission and associated costs required to supply electricity to the point of delivery. Title to and risk of loss of the power to be delivered by the Company to the Purchaser under any transaction shall pass from the Company to the Purchaser upon delivery of the power to the Purchaser at the point of delivery. The parties shall negotiate the responsibility for obtaining and/or providing all necessary transmission and ancillary services and the costs related thereto. The Company shall have the right to receive assurances satisfactory to it that all necessary transmission arrangement are in place prior to committing to any Transaction Agreement pursuant to this Rate Schedule. I.12Notice of Interruption/Curtailment (a) If designated a firm transaction on a Transaction Agreement, firm transaction shall mean a Transaction which is NOT subject to interruption, recall, or other prior claims or rights during the term of that specific Transaction unless such interruption, recall or other prior claim or right occurs : (i) by operation of automatic equipment installed for power system protection, (ii) after consultation, if practicable, at any time that such action is desirable for installation, maintenance, inspection, repairs or replacements of equipment, (iii) at any time that in the sole judgment of the Company such action is necessary to preserve the integrity of, or to prevent or limit any instability on its system, (iv) at any time that the Purchaser is in default for the payment of any bill as outlined in Section 1.8 herein, (v) as a result of force majeure as described in Section 1.11, or (vi) as a result of the Parties agreeing in a specific transaction to other circumstances under which either of the Parties may interrupt without liability. In addition, sales designated non-firm on a Transaction Agreement shall mean a Transaction which is subject to interruption, recall, or other prior claims or rights during the term of that specific Transaction. (b)In the event of sudden or emergency curtailment or interruption of power delivered hereunder, the party experiencing or affected by such interruption or curtailment shall contact the other party s schedulers or dispatchers with direct oral notice or by other agreed means as soon as practicable based on good electric utility practice. Purchaser will be obligated to take all steps necessary to promptly interrupt or curtail service when requested by the Company. I.13Force Majeure The Company and the Purchaser shall use due diligence to perform their obligations under the Service Agreement and any Transaction Agreements thereunder, but conditions may arise which prevent or delay performance by a party because of causes beyond that party s reasonable control which by exercise of due diligence and foresight, a party could not reasonably be expected to avoid. If a party is rendered unable to fulfill any obligations by reason of such causes, it shall be excused from performing to the extent it is prevented or delayed from so doing, but shall exercise due diligence to correct such inability with all reasonable dispatch, and shall not be liable for injury, damage, or loss resulting from such inability. However, settlement of strikes and labor disturbances shall be wholly within the discretion of the affected party. I.14Dispute Resolution The Company and the Purchaser shall attempt in good faith to resolve any disputes that arise under this Rate Schedule, under the Service Agreement, and/or under a Transaction Agreement (other than billing disputes which are discussed in Section 1.8 herein). In the event that the Company and the Purchaser are unable to resolve any such dispute within 30 days of the date on which the dispute arises, they shall submit the matter to binding arbitration to be conducted under the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association. I.15Assignability Any Service Agreement or Transaction Agreement for the sale of capacity, energy, and ancillary services executed under this Rate Schedule shall inure to the benefit of, and shall bind, the successor of the parties thereto, but shall not be assignable without the prior written consent of the other party. In the event the Purchaser assigns or resells to another purchaser any portion of the capacity and associated energy purchased hereunder, the original Purchaser remains liable to the Company for payment of the full amount of such assigned or resold capacity, energy, and ancillary services. I.16Communications Any notice, demand or request provided for in this Rate Schedule shall be deemed to be properly given or made if set forth in writing and delivered or sent by facsimile or first class mail postage prepaid to the Company or to the Purchaser at its principal office to the attention of the individual executing the Service Agreement on behalf of the Company or the Purchaser. However, hourly transactions may be entered into by verbal communication of the rate and terms and conditions contained in the Transaction Agreement. When from time to time, the Parties desire to enter into a Transaction, Operating Representatives on behalf of the Parties shall agree upon all of the terms of that Transaction, including without limitation the type, amount, period, rate of delivery, conditions of interruption, price, and scheduling provisions. Upon agreement to all of the terms of a Transaction, the Company shall send a completed Transaction Agreement to Buyer by facsimile or other mutually acceptable means. The Transaction Agreement will typically be delivered prior to the commencement of the Transaction. However, recognizing that certain Transactions may be entered into orally and require prompt implementation, the Transaction Agreement may not be sent until after the Transaction has been entered into and initiated. Failure of the Company to send a Transaction Agreement or of either Party to execute a Transaction Agreement does not void a Transaction Agreement entered into orally between Operating Representatives of the Parties. A telephone recording device may be used to confirm transactions entered into orally if a Transaction Agreement is not executed. I.17Confidentiality The Company and Purchaser shall treat as confidential all price and rate terms of any proposed or actual Transaction Agreement as well as any other term thereof which may be designated by the Company or Purchaser ( Confidential Matter ). Confidential Matter shall be for the sole and exclusive use of the Company and Purchaser, and, subject to the provisions set forth below, neither the Company nor Purchaser shall publish, disclose, or otherwise divulge the Confidential Matter to any person at any time without the prior written consent of the other unless the release of the Confidential Matter is pursuant to a requirement imposed by the Commission or any other governmental or judicial body of competent jurisdiction. When either the Company or Purchaser receives from any other entity or person a request for Confidential Matter, not then in the public domain, it shall inform the other of such request as soon as reasonably practicable. The Company and Purchaser shall reasonably cooperate with each other in the exercise of any applicable rights to oppose the disclosure of the Confidential Matter to the requester or to prevent the Confidential Matter from becoming part of the public domain. Confidential Matter need not be treated confidentially once it has passed into the public domain. Notwithstanding the above, the Company and Purchaser may disclose quantity and rate/price information to the compilers of market rate indices so long as this information is aggregated into and reported as the average of all similar purchases and sales of power within a specified period, and so long as neither party discloses the name of the other party. I.18Entire Agreement The terms and conditions of this Rate Schedule, the Service Agreement and the Transaction Agreement shall constitute the entire agreement between the parties. Any conflict between these respective documents shall be resolved in favor of the Rate Schedule first, the Service Agreement second, and the Transaction Agreement third. I.19Effects of Federal and State Laws The obligations of the Company and the Purchaser hereunder are subject to any present and future Federal and State laws, orders or other regulations duly promulgated. I.20Applicable Law This Rate Schedule and all Service Agreements executed hereunder shall be interpreted, construed and governed by laws of the State of Ohio. ARTICLE II -Rate Provisions II.1Charges (a)For each transaction, the Purchaser shall pay to the Company such market-based rates as are agreed upon between the Company and the Purchaser and set forth in the Transaction Agreement. (b)It is expressly agreed by the parties that, as part of the compensation to be paid under this Tariff, each Service Agreement and/or Transaction Agreement, if at any time during the term hereof there should be levied and/or assessed against the Company, any direct tax, including, but not limited to environmental (carbon content or otherwise) or similar taxes (other than taxes based on or measured by net income), by any taxing authority on the power and/or energy manufactured, generated, produced, converted, sold, purchased, transmitted, interchanged, exchanged, exported, or imported by the Company on behalf of the Purchaser, the Company shall be responsible for all Taxes prior to the Delivery Point and the Purchaser shall be responsible for all Taxes at the Delivery Point and beyond. The parties also agree that prior approval of any regulatory body having jurisdiction in such matter, if required, shall be obtained as a prerequisite to collection of such direct tax. II.2Records The Company will retain copies of all agreements entered into pursuant to this Rate Schedule, and a record of all charges thereunder, for review on request by the Commission or any Purchaser. On request, the Company will, at Purchaser s cost, provide a summary of charges and other information and data regarding the service and charges. ARTICLE III -Default/Remedy for Default/Indemnity III.1Triggering Event If a Party fails to perform any of the obligations or covenants imposed during the term of this Transaction Agreement, or if a Party: a) makes an assignment or any general arrangement for the benefit of creditors; b) files a petition or otherwise commences, authorizes or acquiesces in the commencement of a proceeding or cause under any bankruptcy or similar law for the protection of creditors, or have such petition filed against it; c) otherwise becomes bankrupt or insolvent (however evidenced); d) is unable to pay its debts as they fall due; or e) fails to provide satisfactory security within forty-eight (48) hours of the request of the other Party should the creditworthiness or financial responsibility of either Party become unsatisfactory, then the Party defaulting, ( Defaulting Party ) shall be in default of the Service Agreement and the Transaction Agreement and the other Party ( Non-Defaulting Party ) shall have the rights as described in this Section. III.2Notice and Curing of Default Upon the occurrence of an event of default, the Non-Defaulting Party must notify in writing the Defaulting Party, stating specifically the nature of the default. The Defaulting Party will have forty eight (48) hours after receipt of the aforesaid notice in which to remedy or remove the cause or causes stated in the notice, or if Defaulting party is unable to fully remedy the instance of default in the exercise of due diligence, the Non-Defaulting Party shall have the right to terminate the Transaction Agreement pursuant to the terms of Section 35.15 of the Commission s regulations. III.3Preservation of Rights Such cancellation of the specific Transaction(s) will be without prejudice to the right of the Non-Defaulting Party to collect any amounts it is then due and without waiver of any other remedy to which the Non-Defaulting Party may be entitled at law or in equity for breach of the Service Agreement or a specific Transaction. III.4Failure of Performance With respect to the unauthorized failure to schedule in whole or in part, deliver or receive energy in accordance with the Transaction Agreement, the liabilities of the Parties shall be as follows: (a)The Dayton Power and Light Company s (the Company ) Default. In the event of Company s default under a Transaction to deliver the scheduled energy for any reason other than force majeure or as otherwise agreed to by the Parties and the default does not result in early termination of a Transaction(s) as permitted in Section 3.4(c), then Company shall be liable to Purchaser s for: a) the undelivered quantity times the difference between the price applicable to the Transaction hereunder and the price, if higher, at which Purchaser is able or would be able, acting in good faith, to obtain comparable supplies; and b) any demand charges which Purchaser has incurred for third party transmission service which the Purchaser does not use in delivering replacement power. (b)Purchaser s Default. In the event of Purchaser s default under a specific Transaction to receive the scheduled energy for any reason other than force majeure or as otherwise agreed to by the Parties and the default does not result in early termination of a Transaction(s) as permitted in Section 3.4(c), then Purchaser shall be liable to the Company for: a) the untaken quantity times the difference between the price hereunder and the price applicable to the Transaction, if lower, at which the Company is able or would be able, acting in good faith, to sell comparable supplies; and b) any demand charges which the Company has incurred for third party transmission service which the Company does not use in delivering the energy to another purchaser. (c)Contractual Right to Liquidate the Transaction(s). Upon early termination of a Transaction(s), the Non-Defaulting Party shall in good faith calculate its Gains, Losses and Costs resulting from the termination of the Terminated Transactions. The Gains, Losses and Costs shall be determined by comparing the value of the remaining term, Contract Quantities and Contract Prices under each Terminated Transaction had it not been terminated to the equivalent quantities and relevant market prices for the remaining term either quoted by a bona fide third-party offer or which are reasonable expected to be available in the market under a replacement contract for each Terminated Transaction. To ascertain the market prices of a replacement contract, the Non-Defaulting Party may consider, among other valuations, any or all of the settlement prices of NYMEX Power futures contracts, quotations from leading dealers in energy swap contracts and other bona fide third-party offers, all adjusted for the length of the remaining term and differences in transmission. It is expressly agreed that a Party shall not be required to enter into replacement transactions in order to determine the Termination Payment. The Non-Defaulting Party shall aggregate such Gains, Losses and Costs with respect to all Transactions into a single net amount ( Termination Payment ) and notify the Defaulting Party. If the Non-Defaulting Party s aggregate Losses and Costs exceed its aggregate Gains, the Defaulting Party shall, within five (5) Business Days of receipt of such notice, pay the Termination Payment to the Non-Defaulting Party, which amount shall bear interest at the Interest Rate from the Early Termination Date until paid. If the Non-Defaulting Party s aggregate Gains exceed its aggregate Losses and Costs, if any, resulting from termination of the Terminated Transactions, the amount of the Termination Payment shall be zero. As used herein with respect to each Party: (i) Costs shall mean, with respect to a Party, brokerage fees, commissions and other similar transaction costs and expenses reasonably incurred by such Party either in terminating any arrangement pursuant to which it has hedged its obligations or entering into new arrangements which replace a Terminated Transaction, and attorney s fees, if any, incurred in connection with enforcing its rights under this Agreement; (ii) Gains shall mean, with respect to a Party, an amount equal to the present value of the economic benefit (exclusive of Costs), if any to it resulting from the termination to its obligations with respect to a Terminated Transaction, determined in a commercially reasonable manner; and (iii) Losses shall mean, with respect to a Party, an amount equal to the present value of the economic loss (exclusive of Costs), if any, to it resulting from the termination of its obligations with respect to a Terminated Transaction, determined in a commercially reasonable manner. (d)Timing of Payment. The Non-Defaulting Party shall submit its calculation of the Defaulting Party s liability and the basis thereof within thirty (30) days of such default Transaction. Defaulting Party shall pay the liability as stated within two (2) business days after receipt of notice. III.5Set Off of Accounts If a default occurs, in addition to its rights under Section 3.4 above and without prejudice to its exercise of its rights under such Section at any time, the Non-Defaulting Party may from time to time set off any or all amounts which the Defaulting Party owes to it (whether under a specific Transaction Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due) against any or all amounts which it owes to the Defaulting Party (whether under a specific Transaction Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due) provided that any amount not due which is included in such setoff shall be discounted to present value as at the time of setoff (to take account of the period between the date of setoff and the date on which such amount would have otherwise been due). To the extent permitted by law, the filing of a petition commencing a bankruptcy proceeding by or against the Defaulting Party shall not operate as a stay to the Non-Defaulting Party s right to set off any or all amounts which the Defaulting Party owes it. If this right is exercised, the amount owed under Section 3.4 shall be reduced accordingly. III.6Minimum Take Requirement If a minimum take requirement is provided for and Purchaser fails to satisfy the minimum take requirement, and such failure is not excused by instances of force majeure, the Purchaser shall remain liable for the total charge attributable to the minimum take specified in the Transaction Agreement. If the Company fails to schedule the energy for delivery, Purchaser shall be relieved of any minimum take requirement to the extent of any non-delivery and for the period of such non-delivery. III.7Indemnity Each Party expressly agrees to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend the other Party against all claims, liability, costs, or expense for loss, damage, or injury to persons or property in any manner directly or indirectly connected with or growing out of, the generation, transmission, or distribution of energy on its own side of the point of delivery hereunder. III.8Liability Limitation FOR BREACH OF ANY PROVISION FOR WHICH AN EXPRESS REMEDY OR MEASURE OF DAMAGES IS PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE LIABILITY OF THE DEFAULTING PARTY SHALL BE LIMITED AS SET FORTH IN SUCH PROVISION, AND ALL OTHER DAMAGES OR REMEDIES HEREBY ARE WAIVED. IF NO REMEDY OR MEASURE OF DAMAGES IS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED, THE LIABILITY OF THE DEFAULTING PARTY SHALL BE LIMITED TO DIRECT DAMAGES ONLY AND ALL OTHER DAMAGES AND REMEDIES ARE WAIVED. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY OR INDIRECT DAMAGES IN TORT, FOR CONTRACT OR OTHERWISE. III.9Set Off of Accounts Each Party reserves to itself all rights, set-offs, counterclaims, and other defenses which it is or may be entitled to arising from or out of the Service Agreement or a specific Transaction. III.10Amounts not a Penalty The Parties agree that the amounts recoverable under this Article are a reasonable pre-estimate of loss and not a penalty. Such amounts are payable for the loss of bargain and the loss of protection against future risks.

THE DAYTON POWER AND LIGHT COMPANY RATE SCHEDULE FOR WHOLESALE POWER SALES AT MARKET-BASED RATES
ARTICLE I- General Terms and Conditions
I.1 General Purpose
The purpose of this Rate Schedule is for The Dayton Power and Light (the "Company" or "Seller") to provide for sales for resale of capacity, energy, and ancillary services at negotiated rates to parties desiring to take power hereunder ("Purchaser(s)"). This Rate Schedule shall become effective on the date established by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (the "Commission").
I.2 Availability
Sales of capacity, energy, and ancillary services under this Rate Schedule are available to Purchasers, including investor-owned corporations, municipalities, rural electric cooperatives, power marketers, power brokers, and other wholesale purchasers, and any associations of such entities. The Company will not engage in any transaction hereunder if to do so would jeopardize its ability to provide reliable and economic service to its native load customers.
1.2.1 Ancillary services.
PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which include spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM, and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchases for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
I.3 Compliance with Commission Regulations.
Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Seller's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the Seller's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Seller's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff.
1.3.1 Seller Category. Seller meets the criteria for being a Category 1 seller in the Northwest, Southeast, and Southwest Power Pool regions and a Category 2 seller in the Northeast, Southwest and Central Regions, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 35.36(a).
I.4 Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority.
The Commission has determined that the Order No. 697 affiliate restrictions codified at 18 C.F.R. 35.39 do not apply to Seller, including the requirement to obtain prior approval for affiliate sales of electric energy or capacity between Seller and its market-regulated power sales affiliates. The Dayton Power and Light Company, Docket No. ER14-594 (Feb. 5, 2014).
I.5 Obligations of the Parties
A Purchaser desiring to take power under this Rate Schedule shall sign a Service Agreement which shall apply to all transactions under this Rate Schedule between the Company and the Purchaser, and shall be accepted for filing by the Commission. By entering into a Transaction Agreement, the Purchaser agrees to take and pay for, and the Company agrees to furnish, such capacity, energy and ancillary services as may be mutually agreed upon, subject to the terms and conditions of this Rate Schedule as it may be in effect from time to time, and subject to the action of the Commission or any successor regulatory agency with jurisdiction over sales for resale of electricity. Each transaction shall be governed by this Rate Schedule, the Service Agreement and the Transaction Agreement exchanged between the parties with respect to such transaction. The parties are relying upon the fact that this Rate Schedule, the Service Agreement and all Transaction Agreements shall together form a single integrated agreement between the parties and that the parties would not otherwise enter into any transactions.
I.6 Termination
This Rate Schedule may be terminated unilaterally by the Company in accordance with any regulatory requirements. Any Service Agreement hereunder may be terminated unilaterally by the Company or the Purchaser at any time in accordance with the requirements of the Commission. Termination of the Rate Schedule or Service Agreement shall not cause the termination prior to the terms of any Transaction Agreement for the sale of capacity, energy and ancillary services that is entered into prior to the termination of the Rate Schedule or Service Agreement, and the Rate Schedule and Service Agreement shall remain in effect until such sale terminates.
I.7 Amendment
The Company shall have the right at any time to amend any provision of this Rate Schedule by furnishing an appropriate statement of such amendment to the Purchaser, and by unilaterally filing the same with the Commission pursuant to the provisions of Section 205 of the Federal Power Act or with such other regulatory agency as may have jurisdiction. Nothing in this Rate Schedule shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of the Company to unilaterally make application to the Commission for a change in rates or in any terms or condition under section 205 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission's Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder.
I.8 Required Approvals
The obligations of the Company and the Purchaser are subject to and conditioned on securing and retaining all rights-of-way, franchises, locations, approvals, permits and other rights and each party agrees to use its reasonable best efforts to secure and retain all such rights-of-way, franchises and other rights and approvals.
I.9 Creditworthiness
In order to satisfy the Company of the ability of Purchaser to meet its obligations under this Rate Schedule, Service Agreement and/or applicable Transaction Agreement(s), the Company may, in accordance with standard commercial practices, conduct reasonable credit reviews. The Company may require Purchaser to provide and maintain in effect during the term of the Service Agreement, or applicable Transaction Agreement(s), such credit guaranty or surety, including but not limited to, an unconditional and irrevocable letter of credit, as well, in the Company's commercially reasonable judgment, provide adequate security for protection against the risk of nonpayment for transactions under the Service Agreement or applicable Transaction Agreement(s).
I.10 Billing and Payments
)a( All bills shall be rendered monthly in such reasonable detail as the Purchaser may request. All bills shall be due and payable upon presentation. In the event of a dispute as to the amount of any bill, the Purchaser will notify the Company of the amount in dispute and the Purchaser will pay to the Company the total bill including the disputed amount. The Company shall refund, with interest at the rate described in paragraph (d), any portion of the disputed, amount ultimately found to be incorrect. In the event adequate billing data are not available, bills may be rendered on an estimated basis subject to prompt corrective adjustment when such data are received.
)b( The Purchaser shall not have the right to challenge any bill, invoice or statement or bring any court or administrative action of any kind questioning the same or seeking refunds after a period of 12 months from the date it is rendered. In the case of a bill, invoice or statement containing estimates, the Purchaser shall not have the right to challenge its accuracy after a period of 12 months from the date it is adjusted to reflect the actual amounts due. The Purchaser's rights hereunder relate to the accuracy of the billing computation and do not relate to the justness and reasonableness of the rate negotiated between Company and the Purchaser.
)c( Within a reasonable time after the first day of each month, the Company shall submit an invoice to the Purchaser for the charges for all service provided under the Service Agreement for the preceding month. In order that bills may be rendered promptly after the end of each month, it may be necessary, from time to time, to estimate certain factors involved in calculating the monthly billing. Adjustments for errors in such estimates shall be included in subsequent bills at the time the information becomes available to make the required corrections or adjustment. The invoice shall be paid by the Purchaser so that Company will receive the funds by the twentieth (20th) day after the date that such invoice is rendered. All payments shall be made in immediately available funds payable to Company, or by electronic transfer to a bank named by Company. When payments are made by mail, bills shall be considered as having been paid on the date of receipt by Company.
If by check: The Dayton Power and Light Company 1065 Woodman Drive Dayton, Ohio 45432 Attention: Jennifer Kendo
If by wire transfer: Bank One, Columbus ABA # 044000037 Account No. 905753680 Confirmation of transfer: Name: Jennifer Kendo Telephone: (937) 259-7890
)d( Interest on any unpaid amount shall be calculated in accordance with the methodology specified for interest on refunds in the Commissions regulations at 18 C.F.R. 35.19(a)(2)(iii). Interest on delinquent amounts shall be calculated from the due date of the bill to the date of payment. In order to deal with any abuse of the payment procedures, Company may, at its sole discretion, choose to impose in addition to the interest payment a late payment fee on a late payment equal to the product of the payment due times two percent (2%). Any invoice unpaid 30 days after the payment is due shall be subject to this late payment fee and the late payment fee will accrue on a monthly basis.
I.11 Points of Delivery and Metering
The Company shall provide power to Purchaser at the agreed-upon point(s) of delivery under each Transaction Agreement, subject to the following conditions: a) services shall be provided in accordance with good electric utility practice; b) the Company shall verify all deliveries of power at the interconnection delivery point; c) unless otherwise agreed, the Company shall bear the risk for all transmission losses up to the point of delivery; and d) the Company shall be responsible for all transmission and associated costs required to supply electricity to the point of delivery. Title to and risk of loss of the power to be delivered by the Company to the Purchaser under any transaction shall pass from the Company to the Purchaser upon delivery of the power to the Purchaser at the point of delivery.
The parties shall negotiate the responsibility for obtaining and/or providing all necessary transmission and ancillary services and the costs related thereto. The Company shall have the right to receive assurances satisfactory to it that all necessary transmission arrangement are in place prior to committing to any Transaction Agreement pursuant to this Rate Schedule.
I.12 Notice of Interruption/Curtailment
)a( "If designated a firm transaction on a Transaction Agreement, firm transaction shall mean a Transaction which is NOT subject to interruption, recall, or other prior claims or rights during the term of that specific Transaction unless such interruption, recall or other prior claim or right occurs : (i) by operation of automatic equipment installed for power system protection, (ii) after consultation, if practicable, at any time that such action is desirable for installation, maintenance, inspection, repairs or replacements of equipment, (iii) at any time that in the sole judgment of the Company such action is necessary to preserve the integrity of, or to prevent or limit any instability on its system, (iv) at any time that the Purchaser is in default for the payment of any bill as outlined in Section 1.8 herein, (v) as a result of force majeure as described in Section 1.11, or (vi) as a result of the Parties agreeing in a specific transaction to other circumstances under which either of the Parties may interrupt without liability. In addition, sales designated non-firm on a Transaction Agreement shall mean a Transaction which is subject to interruption, recall, or other prior claims or rights during the term of that specific Transaction."
)b( In the event of sudden or emergency curtailment or interruption of power delivered hereunder, the party experiencing or affected by such interruption or curtailment shall contact the other party's schedulers or dispatchers with direct oral notice or by other agreed means as soon as practicable based on good electric utility practice. Purchaser will be obligated to take all steps necessary to promptly interrupt or curtail service when requested by the Company.
I.13 Force Majeure
The Company and the Purchaser shall use due diligence to perform their obligations under the Service Agreement and any Transaction Agreements thereunder, but conditions may arise which prevent or delay performance by a party because of causes beyond that party's reasonable control which by exercise of due diligence and foresight, a party could not reasonably be expected to avoid. If a party is rendered unable to fulfill any obligations by reason of such causes, it shall be excused from performing to the extent it is prevented or delayed from so doing, but shall exercise due diligence to correct such inability with all reasonable dispatch, and shall not be liable for injury, damage, or loss resulting from such inability. However, settlement of strikes and labor disturbances shall be wholly within the discretion of the affected party.
I.14 Dispute Resolution
The Company and the Purchaser shall attempt in good faith to resolve any disputes that arise under this Rate Schedule, under the Service Agreement, and/or under a Transaction Agreement (other than billing disputes which are discussed in Section 1.8 herein). In the event that the Company and the Purchaser are unable to resolve any such dispute within 30 days of the date on which the dispute arises, they shall submit the matter to binding arbitration to be conducted under the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association.
I.15 Assignability
Any Service Agreement or Transaction Agreement for the sale of capacity, energy, and ancillary services executed under this Rate Schedule shall inure to the benefit of, and shall bind, the successor of the parties thereto, but shall not be assignable without the prior written consent of the other party. In the event the Purchaser assigns or resells to another purchaser any portion of the capacity and associated energy purchased hereunder, the original Purchaser remains liable to the Company for payment of the full amount of such assigned or resold capacity, energy, and ancillary services.
I.16 Communications
Any notice, demand or request provided for in this Rate Schedule shall be deemed to be properly given or made if set forth in writing and delivered or sent by facsimile or first class mail postage prepaid to the Company or to the Purchaser at its principal office to the attention of the individual executing the Service Agreement on behalf of the Company or the Purchaser. However, hourly transactions may be entered into by verbal communication of the rate and terms and conditions contained in the Transaction Agreement.
When from time to time, the Parties desire to enter into a Transaction, Operating Representatives on behalf of the Parties shall agree upon all of the terms of that Transaction, including without limitation the type, amount, period, rate of delivery, conditions of interruption, price, and scheduling provisions. Upon agreement to all of the terms of a Transaction, the Company shall send a completed Transaction Agreement to Buyer by facsimile or other mutually acceptable means. The Transaction Agreement will typically be delivered prior to the commencement of the Transaction. However, recognizing that certain Transactions may be entered into orally and require prompt implementation, the Transaction Agreement may not be sent until after the Transaction has been entered into and initiated. Failure of the Company to send a Transaction Agreement or of either Party to execute a Transaction Agreement does not void a Transaction Agreement entered into orally between Operating Representatives of the Parties. A telephone recording device may be used to confirm transactions entered into orally if a Transaction Agreement is not executed.
I.17 Confidentiality
The Company and Purchaser shall treat as confidential all price and rate terms of any proposed or actual Transaction Agreement as well as any other term thereof which may be designated by the Company or Purchaser ("Confidential Matter"). Confidential Matter shall be for the sole and exclusive use of the Company and Purchaser, and, subject to the provisions set forth below, neither the Company nor Purchaser shall publish, disclose, or otherwise divulge the Confidential Matter to any person at any time without the prior written consent of the other unless the release of the Confidential Matter is pursuant to a requirement imposed by the Commission or any other governmental or judicial body of competent jurisdiction. When either the Company or Purchaser receives from any other entity or person a request for Confidential Matter, not then in the public domain, it shall inform the other of such request as soon as reasonably practicable. The Company and Purchaser shall reasonably cooperate with each other in the exercise of any applicable rights to oppose the disclosure of the Confidential Matter to the requester or to prevent the Confidential Matter from becoming part of the public domain. Confidential Matter need not be treated confidentially once it has passed into the public domain. Notwithstanding the above, the Company and Purchaser may disclose quantity and rate/price information to the compilers of market rate indices so long as this information is aggregated into and reported as the average of all similar purchases and sales of power within a specified period, and so long as neither party discloses the name of the other party. I.18 Entire Agreement
The terms and conditions of this Rate Schedule, the Service Agreement and the Transaction Agreement shall constitute the entire agreement between the parties. Any conflict between these respective documents shall be resolved in favor of the Rate Schedule first, the Service Agreement second, and the Transaction Agreement third.
I.19 Effects of Federal and State Laws
The obligations of the Company and the Purchaser hereunder are subject to any present and future Federal and State laws, orders or other regulations duly promulgated.
I.20 Applicable Law
This Rate Schedule and all Service Agreements executed hereunder shall be interpreted, construed and governed by laws of the State of Ohio.
ARTICLE II- Rate Provisions
II.1 Charges
)a( For each transaction, the Purchaser shall pay to the Company such market-based rates as are agreed upon between the Company and the Purchaser and set forth in the Transaction Agreement.
)b( It is expressly agreed by the parties that, as part of the compensation to be paid under this Tariff, each Service Agreement and/or Transaction Agreement, if at any time during the term hereof there should be levied and/or assessed against the Company, any direct tax, including, but not limited to environmental (carbon content or otherwise) or similar taxes (other than taxes based on or measured by net income), by any taxing authority on the power and/or energy manufactured, generated, produced, converted, sold, purchased, transmitted, interchanged, exchanged, exported, or imported by the Company on behalf of the Purchaser, the Company shall be responsible for all Taxes prior to the Delivery Point and the Purchaser shall be responsible for all Taxes at the Delivery Point and beyond. The parties also agree that prior approval of any regulatory body having jurisdiction in such matter, if required, shall be obtained as a prerequisite to collection of such direct tax.
II.2 Records
The Company will retain copies of all agreements entered into pursuant to this Rate Schedule, and a record of all charges thereunder, for review on request by the Commission or any Purchaser. On request, the Company will, at Purchaser's cost, provide a summary of charges and other information and data regarding the service and charges.
ARTICLE III- Default/Remedy for Default/Indemnity
III.1 Triggering Event
If a Party fails to perform any of the obligations or covenants imposed during the term of this Transaction Agreement, or if a Party: a) makes an assignment or any general arrangement for the benefit of creditors; b) files a petition or otherwise commences, authorizes or acquiesces in the commencement of a proceeding or cause under any bankruptcy or similar law for the protection of creditors, or have such petition filed against it; c) otherwise becomes bankrupt or insolvent (however evidenced); d) is unable to pay its debts as they fall due; or e) fails to provide satisfactory security within forty-eight (48) hours of the request of the other Party should the creditworthiness or financial responsibility of either Party become unsatisfactory, then the Party defaulting, ("Defaulting Party") shall be in default of the Service Agreement and the Transaction Agreement and the other Party ("Non-Defaulting Party") shall have the rights as described in this Section.
III.2 Notice and Curing of Default
Upon the occurrence of an event of default, the Non-Defaulting Party must notify in writing the Defaulting Party, stating specifically the nature of the default. The Defaulting Party will have forty eight (48) hours after receipt of the aforesaid notice in which to remedy or remove the cause or causes stated in the notice, or if Defaulting party is unable to fully remedy the instance of default in the exercise of due diligence, the Non-Defaulting Party shall have the right to terminate the Transaction Agreement pursuant to the terms of Section 35.15 of the Commission's regulations.
III.3 Preservation of Rights
Such cancellation of the specific Transaction(s) will be without prejudice to the right of the Non-Defaulting Party to collect any amounts it is then due and without waiver of any other remedy to which the Non-Defaulting Party may be entitled at law or in equity for breach of the Service Agreement or a specific Transaction.
III.4 Failure of Performance
With respect to the unauthorized failure to schedule in whole or in part, deliver or receive energy in accordance with the Transaction Agreement, the liabilities of the Parties shall be as follows:
)a( The Dayton Power and Light Company's (the "Company") Default. In the event of Company's default under a Transaction to deliver the scheduled energy for any reason other than force majeure or as otherwise agreed to by the Parties and the default does not result in early termination of a Transaction(s) as permitted in Section 3.4(c), then Company shall be liable to Purchaser's for: a) the undelivered quantity times the difference between the price applicable to the Transaction hereunder and the price, if higher, at which Purchaser is able or would be able, acting in good faith, to obtain comparable supplies; and b) any demand charges which Purchaser has incurred for third party transmission service which the Purchaser does not use in delivering replacement power. )b( Purchaser's Default. In the event of Purchaser's default under a specific Transaction to receive the scheduled energy for any reason other than force majeure or as otherwise agreed to by the Parties and the default does not result in early termination of a Transaction(s) as permitted in Section 3.4(c), then Purchaser shall be liable to the Company for: a) the untaken quantity times the difference between the price hereunder and the price applicable to the Transaction, if lower, at which the Company is able or would be able, acting in good faith, to sell comparable supplies; and b) any demand charges which the Company has incurred for third party transmission service which the Company does not use in delivering the energy to another purchaser.
)c( Contractual Right to Liquidate the Transaction(s). Upon early termination of a Transaction(s), the Non-Defaulting Party shall in good faith calculate its Gains, Losses and Costs resulting from the termination of the Terminated Transactions. The Gains, Losses and Costs shall be determined by comparing the value of the remaining term, Contract Quantities and Contract Prices under each Terminated Transaction had it not been terminated to the equivalent quantities and relevant market prices for the remaining term either quoted by a bona fide third-party offer or which are reasonable expected to be available in the market under a replacement contract for each Terminated Transaction. To ascertain the market prices of a replacement contract, the Non-Defaulting Party may consider, among other valuations, any or all of the settlement prices of NYMEX Power futures contracts, quotations from leading dealers in energy swap contracts and other bona fide third-party offers, all adjusted for the length of the remaining term and differences in transmission. It is expressly agreed that a Party shall not be required to enter into replacement transactions in order to determine the Termination Payment. The Non-Defaulting Party shall aggregate such Gains, Losses and Costs with respect to all Transactions into a single net amount ('Termination Payment") and notify the Defaulting Party. If the Non-Defaulting Party's aggregate Losses and Costs exceed its aggregate Gains, the Defaulting Party shall, within five (5) Business Days of receipt of such notice, pay the Termination Payment to the Non-Defaulting Party, which amount shall bear interest at the Interest Rate from the Early Termination Date until paid. If the Non-Defaulting Party's aggregate Gains exceed its aggregate Losses and Costs, if any, resulting from termination of the Terminated Transactions, the amount of the Termination Payment shall be zero. As used herein with respect to each Party: (i) "Costs" shall mean, with respect to a Party, brokerage fees, commissions and other similar transaction costs and expenses reasonably incurred by such Party either in terminating any arrangement pursuant to which it has hedged its obligations or entering into new arrangements which replace a Terminated Transaction, and attorney's fees, if any, incurred in connection with enforcing its rights under this Agreement; (ii) "Gains" shall mean, with respect to a Party, an amount equal to the present value of the economic benefit (exclusive of Costs), if any to it resulting from the termination to its obligations with respect to a Terminated Transaction, determined in a commercially reasonable manner; and (iii) "Losses" shall mean, with respect to a Party, an amount equal to the present value of the economic loss (exclusive of Costs), if any, to it resulting from the termination of its obligations with respect to a Terminated Transaction, determined in a commercially reasonable manner.
)d( Timing of Payment. The Non-Defaulting Party shall submit its calculation of the Defaulting Party's liability and the basis thereof within thirty (30) days of such default Transaction. Defaulting Party shall pay the liability as stated within two (2) business days after receipt of notice.
III.5 Set Off of Accounts
If a default occurs, in addition to its rights under Section 3.4 above and without prejudice to its exercise of its rights under such Section at any time, the Non-Defaulting Party may from time to time set off any or all amounts which the Defaulting Party owes to it (whether under a specific Transaction Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due) against any or all amounts which it owes to the Defaulting Party (whether under a specific Transaction Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due) provided that any amount not due which is included in such setoff shall be discounted to present value as at the time of setoff (to take account of the period between the date of setoff and the date on which such amount would have otherwise been due). To the extent permitted by law, the filing of a petition commencing a bankruptcy proceeding by or against the Defaulting Party shall not operate as a stay to the Non-Defaulting Party's right to set off any or all amounts which the Defaulting Party owes it. If this right is exercised, the amount owed under Section 3.4 shall be reduced accordingly.
III.6 Minimum Take Requirement
If a minimum take requirement is provided for and Purchaser fails to satisfy the minimum take requirement, and such failure is not excused by instances of force majeure, the Purchaser shall remain liable for the total charge attributable to the minimum take specified in the Transaction Agreement. If the Company fails to schedule the energy for delivery, Purchaser shall be relieved of any minimum take requirement to the extent of any non-delivery and for the period of such non-delivery.
III.7 Indemnity
Each Party expressly agrees to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend the other Party against all claims, liability, costs, or expense for loss, damage, or injury to persons or property in any manner directly or indirectly connected with or growing out of, the generation, transmission, or distribution of energy on its own side of the point of delivery hereunder.
III.8 Liability Limitation
FOR BREACH OF ANY PROVISION FOR WHICH AN EXPRESS REMEDY OR MEASURE OF DAMAGES IS PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE LIABILITY OF THE DEFAULTING PARTY SHALL BE LIMITED AS SET FORTH IN SUCH PROVISION, AND ALL OTHER DAMAGES OR REMEDIES HEREBY ARE WAIVED. IF NO REMEDY OR MEASURE OF MAGES IS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED, THE LIABILITY OF THE DEFAULTING PARTY SHALL BE LIMITED TO DIRECT DAMAGES ONLY AND ALL OTHER DAMAGES AND REMEDIES ARE WAIVED. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY OR INDIRECT DAMAGES IN TORT, FOR CONTRACT OR OTHERWISE. III.9 Set off of Accounts
Each Party reserves to itself all rights, set-offs, counterclaims, and other defenses which it is or may be entitled to arising from or out of the Service Agreement or a specific Transaction.
III.10 Amounts not a Penalty
The Parties agree that the amounts recoverable under this Article are a reasonable pre-estimate of loss and not a penalty. Such amounts are payable for the loss of bargain and the loss of protection against future risks.
record_data.filing_title: Revised Tariff Sheets for Market-Based Rate Tariffs
